pr_title: Action to convert pants project to bsp

timeline.message: Action to convert pants project to bsp

timeline.bodyText: Instead of hardcoding a version here I think we can use latest.stable instead, which will let Coursier figure out the latest stable Metals version.
timeline.author: olafurpg

replies.bodyText: I expected coursier to have something like this, but didn't find it initially. Changed.
replies.author: lukaszwawrzyk

timeline.bodyText:
To avoid confusion whether this action modifies the existing Pants project. Is it too verbose? We could also call it "Create new BSP project" 🤔

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                          text="Convert to BSP project">
          
          
            
                          text="Create new BSP project based on this Pants project">
timeline.author: olafurpg
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -73,6 +73,10 @@
               class="com.twitter.intellij.pants.compiler.actions.PantsCompileCurrentTargetAction"
               text="Compile target(s) in the selected editor">
       </action>
+      <action id="com.twitter.intellij.pants.ui.PantsToBspProjectAction"
+              class="com.twitter.intellij.pants.ui.PantsToBspProjectAction"

replies.bodyText: I did it with the longer one, I think we have space for it :)

timeline.bodyText:
It looks like these are absolute paths since the generated project is named .Users.lgeirsson.workspace.source...

I think we can fix this by stripping the prefix containing the absolute path to the Pants workspace away
- INFO  process: /Users/lgeirsson/workspace/source/pants ... /Users/lgeirsson/workspace/source/buildcache::
+ INFO  process: /Users/lgeirsson/workspace/source/pants ... buildcache::
timeline.author: olafurpg

replies.bodyText:
@olafurpg I will push potential fix, Yet I couldn't reproduce. If you could tell me how you setup the pants project to get this problem I could test it.
I just take bsp-pants repo on branch scratchfile, I do import pants project pointing to 'scratchfile' directory and proceed with defaults. This results in targets being a List("scratchfile/::") and project is named "scratchfile.".
replies.author: lukaszwawrzyk

timeline.bodyText: cc/ @wiwa can you elaborate on what is needed in order to collect the correct metrics here?

replies.bodyText: We need to be able to have a fastpass.properties config file on the classpath as implemented in https://github.com/scalameta/metals/pull/1582/files#diff-1ff86c347afd6af0342fc1157784b735R39
replies.author: wiwa

replies.bodyText: @olafurpg I implemented removing the "/" Hope it works now, as I don't have reproduction for full directory in target names.
replies.author: lukaszwawrzyk

timeline.bodyText: We download the newest coursier here. Imo this should either be changed to  some fixed version, or logged. Without it we lose information about coursier version that may be essential to reproduce potential bugs.
timeline.author: tpasternak

replies.bodyText: This is a good point. If we copy the coursier bootstrap script from resources then we always use the same coursier version
replies.author: olafurpg

timeline.bodyText: It would be nice to log downloaded metals version or fix it in code.
timeline.author: tpasternak

replies.bodyText: I don't think we can tell the exact Metals version from this command when using latest.stable. One alternative would be to additionally launch a version command so that we can log what version got picked up 🤔
replies.author: olafurpg

replies.bodyText: Right, but I think it's not essential for this PR, so it can be done as a follow-up (as well as the cousier-verison related issue). Nevertheless it must be done soon, as bug fixing may be very hard without it, in some specific cases.
replies.author: tpasternak
